episodeTitle: Zoro Bares His Fangs! A Savage Animal Stands in the Way!
episodeTitleJapanese: 牙をむくゾロ！立ちはだかった野獣！
episodeTitleRomanized: Kiba o muku Zoro! Tachihadakatta yajū
description: The Straw Hats continue their journey through the forest toward the Palace of the Sea God. When they encounter an entranced Zoro, Luffy battles his swordsman while the others discover that Noko the seahorse is the true culprit behind their stolen memories. Sanji's decisive attack breaks Noko's hypnotic control and restores the crew's memories.

events.title: Journey Through the Forest
events.description: The Straw Hats travel through a dense forest on their way to the Palace of the Sea God. Robin leads the group as she's the only one who retains her memories of their mission.
events.significance: Continues the Ocean's Dream Arc plot as the crew seeks to recover their lost memories.

events.title: Entranced Zoro Appears
events.description: The crew encounters Zoro emerging from the forest, but he appears to be under Noko's hypnotic control. His eyes show he's not in his right mind, and he draws his swords in a threatening manner.
events.significance: Escalates the conflict as the crew realizes Noko's hypnotic powers extend beyond just memory theft.

events.title: Luffy vs. Entranced Zoro
events.description: Luffy decides to fight the hypnotized Zoro to prevent him from harming the rest of the crew. He urges the others to continue toward the Palace of the Sea God without him while he holds Zoro back.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's leadership and willingness to face his own crewmate to protect the others. Shows the serious threat posed by Noko's hypnotic abilities.

quotes.text: You guys go on ahead! I'll handle Zoro!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy takes responsibility for stopping Zoro while the crew continues their mission

events.title: Zoro Uses Oni Giri Under Hypnosis
events.description: The entranced Zoro unleashes his powerful Oni Giri (Demon Slash) technique against Luffy, showcasing his full combat abilities even while under hypnotic control.
events.significance: Demonstrates that hypnotized individuals retain their combat skills, making them extremely dangerous opponents.

events.title: Crew Splits Up
events.description: Following Luffy's orders, Robin, Nami, Sanji, Usopp, and Chopper continue forward while Luffy stays behind to battle Zoro. The crew reluctantly agrees to press on toward their objective.
events.significance: Shows the crew's trust in Luffy's judgment and their determination to complete their mission despite the danger.

events.title: Discovery of Drim
events.description: The remaining crew members encounter and apprehend Drim, the cloaked boy they believed had been stealing their memories. They confront him about his role in the memory theft.
events.significance: Represents a turning point as the crew gets closer to understanding the true nature of the memory theft.

events.title: Noko Revealed as True Culprit
events.description: The crew discovers that Noko the seahorse, not Drim, has been the one stealing their memories all along. They realize that Drim was also a victim of Noko's hypnotic powers and was being controlled.
events.significance: Major plot revelation that recontextualizes the entire arc. Shows that Drim is not the villain but another victim of Noko's manipulation.

events.title: Noko's Hypnotic Eye Technique
events.description: Noko attempts to use his hypnotic eyes on the Straw Hats, locking eyes with them to take control. The crew realizes they must avoid direct eye contact to resist his powers.
events.significance: Reveals the mechanism of Noko's hypnotic abilities and establishes the rules for resisting his control.

events.title: Crew Confronts Noko
events.description: The Straw Hats engage Noko in battle at the lakeside, fighting while trying to avoid his hypnotic gaze. They must find a way to defeat him and recover their stolen memories.
events.significance: Climactic battle of the episode that will determine whether the crew can recover their memories.

events.title: Sanji's Decisive Kick
events.description: Sanji delivers a powerful kick to Noko, physically striking the seahorse creature. The crew members close their eyes during the attack to avoid Noko's hypnotic gaze while Sanji attacks.
events.significance: Sanji's combat prowess proves crucial in breaking Noko's hold. Shows teamwork as the crew coordinates to avoid eye contact while enabling Sanji's attack.

events.title: Memory Restoration Begins
events.description: After Sanji's attack forces Noko away from the crew, the remaining Straw Hats begin to recover their stolen memories. The hypnotic control starts to break as Noko loses his grip on them.
events.significance: Turning point in the arc as the crew starts regaining what was stolen from them. Validates their efforts to confront Noko directly.

events.title: Zoro Emerges from Forest
events.description: Zoro emerges from the forest and approaches the lakeside where the crew is gathered. Initially, Sanji defensively attacks him, uncertain if he's still under hypnotic control.
events.significance: Creates tension as the crew is unsure whether Zoro has been freed from Noko's control.

events.title: Zoro Confirms Memory Recovery
events.description: Zoro reveals that he has also regained his memories and is no longer under hypnotic control. He informs the crew that Luffy was following behind him through the forest.
events.significance: Confirms that breaking Noko's direct control can free all affected individuals, giving hope for complete victory.

quotes.text: You guys go on ahead! I'll handle Zoro!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy takes responsibility for stopping Zoro while the crew continues their mission

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the crew's trust in each other as Luffy fights Zoro alone while the others pursue their objective, and later as they coordinate to fight Noko without making eye contact.
themes.symbolism: The splitting of the crew represents their individual strengths coming together for a common goal.

themes.description: The ongoing struggle to recover stolen memories explores themes of identity and what makes someone who they are.
themes.symbolism: The hypnotized Zoro represents the loss of self when memories are taken away.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates leadership by taking on the dangerous task of fighting his own crewmate to protect the others, showing his willingness to make difficult decisions.
keyActions: Orders crew to continue without him
quotes: You guys go on ahead! I'll handle Zoro!

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji proves crucial in the battle against Noko, delivering the decisive strike that breaks the seahorse's control over the crew.
keyActions: Kicks Noko away from the crew
Attacks Zoro defensively when uncertain of his status
Coordinates with crew to avoid eye contact

characterSpotlights.development: As the only crew member who retained her memories, Robin continues to guide the crew toward recovering what they've lost.
keyActions: Leads the crew through the forest
Helps identify Noko as the true culprit

characterSpotlights.development: Under hypnotic control, Zoro demonstrates his combat prowess even without his own will, but ultimately breaks free from Noko's influence.
keyActions: Attacks Luffy with Oni Giri while hypnotized
Regains memories and rejoins the crew

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Ocean's Dream Arc is anime-only filler and does not appear in the manga. It was based on the PlayStation game 'One Piece: Ocean's Dream!'

trivia.fact: This episode marked the final episode screenwritten by Junki Takegami, who had been writing for One Piece since the beginning of the series.
The episode achieved a TV rating of 10.9%, ranking 5th for that week in Japan.
The Ocean's Dream Arc was based on the PlayStation game 'One Piece: Ocean's Dream!' released in 2003, making it one of the few anime arcs directly adapted from a video game.

sources.title: Ocean's Dream Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The ending theme 'Mirai Kōkai' by Tackey & Tsubasa was replaced with 'Eternal Pose' for FUNimation releases due to licensing issues.
